creator: tyler.baysinger@autodesk.com
text:
When running Apache 2.0.55 and OpenSSL 0.9.7 in front tomcat 4.1.27 we 
encounter the below error when uploading files in excess of 7.26 KB:
WSRuntimeException: can not parse multipart data
(covers java.io.IOException: Invalid Form Data, no boundary encountered.
at http.utils.multipartrequest.MultipartRequest.parse(MultipartRequest.java:897)
at http.utils.multipartrequest.MultipartRequest.initParser
(MultipartRequest.java:631)
at http.utils.multipartrequest.MultipartRequest.<init>
(MultipartRequest.java:368)

When we rolled back toApache 2.0.53 and OpenSSL 0.9.7 the error was not 
observed.  There was some work on cache_conditional lately and we are wondering 
if this is related.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
PR 37145 could be the issue.  Fix:

http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=16744
Assume this was fixed with bug 37145
creator: slive@apache.org
